text: Hi, I have the same issue and would be curious to know how you solved this. I'm thinking of doing a user export via <https://takeout.google.com/> and parse the `.mbox` file

Hey <@U088PQ36PGU>! I'm still mid-way through this project - but have found the best way to export from Gmail for the API is into an xlsx / csv file using <https://script.google.com/home|Google Script> (to save the extra step from .mbox files).

I'm currently in the process of configuring the API so happy to revert back when (or if!) I'm successful.

Thank you, interesting!

Why are you using the API instead of uploading via csv?

You're not able to map the fields 'Email to address', 'Email from address' using the native email import functionality. This meant emails showed up with blank dashes as 'From' and 'To', which isn't ideal!

If this works for you, that's definitely a much quicker and easier option :slightly_smiling_face:
Interesting! I think you are correct. You can set the "Email Direction" but not the "email from address"

Hi. All. I'm trying to query crm/v3/objects/leads/search API, but I'm getting missing "crm.objects.leads.read" scope error. I added the scope to my private app and reauthenticated, but I'm still getting the same error. Is scope adding eventually consistent, or is there something else I'm doing wrong? I tried searching the public docs and forums, but found nothing
Ah, I need to pass the scope during authorization to oauth/authorize. Please disregard! :slightly_smiling_face:
